did.abstract: One 1894 certificate stating that Morris Patterson Harris has contributed five dollars toward the erection of the Nathan Hale Memorial in Huntington, Long Island.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. A. Lloyd Lott, 1952.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: In 1894, the Town of Huntington, Long Island, New York erected a granite monument in memory of Captain Nathan Hale, who had landed at Huntington in 1776 on an intelligence-gathering mission for the Continental Army that ultimately resulted in his capture and execution by the British Army.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Nathan Hale Memorial Association certificate, 1977.379, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One certificate, dated May 17, 1894, stating that Morris Patterson Harris has contributed five dollars toward the erection of the Nathan Hale Memorial in Huntington, Long Island.
